Package nl.uu.cs.aplib.exampleUsages.miniDungeon.testAgent

Class MyAgentState

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.mainConcepts.SimpleState
nl.uu.cs.aplib.agents.State
eu.iv4xr.framework.mainConcepts.Iv4xrAgentState<Void>
nl.uu.cs.aplib.exampleUsages.miniDungeon.testAgent.MyAgentState
public class MyAgentState extends Iv4xrAgentState<Void>
Provides an implementation of agent state SimpleState. The state defined here inherits from Iv4xrAgentState, so it also keeps a historical WorldModel.
Author:
wish

    • setEnvironment

      public MyAgentState setEnvironment​(Environment env)
      Description copied from class: Iv4xrAgentState
      Link the given environment to this State. An instance of Iv4xrEnvironment is needed as the environment.
      Overrides:
      setEnvironment in class Iv4xrAgentState<Void>
      Parameters:
      env - The Environment we want to associate with this state.
      Returns:
      The method simply returns this state to allow it to be used in the Fluent Interface style.

    • updateState

      public void updateState​(String agentId)
      Description copied from class: Iv4xrAgentState
      This will call the observe() method of the environment attached to this state to obtain a fresh observation, and then uses it to update this state. If Iv4xrAgentState.worldmodel exists, this new observation will be merged into the Iv4xrAgentState.worldmodel.
      Overrides:
      updateState in class Iv4xrAgentState<Void>
